website_summaries.verdict: These high-quality pages don't show any bleed-through with traditional and fountain pens, although they don't fare as well with liquid inks.
pros: Comes in ruled, dot grid, and blank pages
No bleed through with traditional or fountain pens
cons: Liquid pen inks may bleed through the pages

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend for Bullet Journal Enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Rhodia Black Webnotebook based on another peron's review of a different yet similar product. I am very happy with this book. I purchased it to start bullet journaling, and so far it has fulfilled that purpose perfectly. The pages are great in that there is very minimal (if any) visibility of writing on front/back of pages. Pic: the back of the picture has writing all over it, though it hardly shows through the other side.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, as expected
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, as expected. The paper is outstandingly smooth and takes ink beautifully. There's little to no ghosting or bleedthrough with three of the inks I had in pens at the time (the attached pics are of my mini random testing for my own benefit.), with the exception of Apache Sunset in my flex nib. I wish the marker ribbon was a tad longer and the dots not quite as pronounced, but I have very few complaints about it! I'm looking forward to using it! No, it doesn't have some of the other things the Leuchterm1917 (which I also have and love) has, like a dedicated index or pre-numbered pages, but it's got LT1917 beat paper-wise, although not by much.
customer_reviews.author: SarahTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $20!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this notebook for my bullet journal, and I LOVED it!!! I noticed a loose string in the middle, but eh, no big deal, right? WRONG!! I have had it for exactly one month yesterday, and the binding has ripped apart. See photos. I am SO upset, because I have spent so much time and effort perfecting each page, and was so happy with everything else about it. Will NOT be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Schmendrick

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful lined notebook  Is it "too good"?
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if I will be able to use this notebook. It is like that fine china we hesitate to use. It is even better than the pictures show. The end paper is beautiful and has a zebra on it. It has a bookmark ribbon that matches the outside band. The paper is high quality. I think this would make a lovely gift. It is too nice for the use I had intended. It makes me think I suddenly need to jet to Paris and keep travel notes. If only my station in life would allow.
customer_reviews.author: J. Finch

customer_reviews.title: The grid is one of my favorite notebook features
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I got along without grid notebooks. The grids are light enough that just taking notes you can draw right other them, or they guide your drawings, or creating grids for projects, designs, technically needs, etc. The use-cases are extremely high. Better than just lined for taking notes, and as an artist, for preparing a grid for a layout, or planning a composition, the grid has so many great uses. This notebook is a great size for general purpose and the feel of the cover is great!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: Lovely for Bujo
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth paper, perfect for bullet journaling. I've written on this in Staedtler Fineliner, no bleeding or ghosting, I've glued leaves and plants in, no warping of the paper, the only slight problem is that with certain pens it can smear within the first 10 or so seconds of writing, so just make sure what youve written is dry really! Also really love the pocket in the back, it's great for holding my planner stickers !
customer_reviews.author: Moon

customer_reviews.title: Great for handling different kinds of ink
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Paper quality is fantastic, great for handling different kinds of pens, inks, and markers without any bleedthrough and very little showthrough. - Comes with one built-in bookmark. - Writing on this with a fountain pen >>> writing on it with any other instrument. I was wondering what the hype was about this notebook until I unlocked this experience. Cons: - Front of the first lined page is impossible to write on comfortably. - The texture and feel of the cover though is off-putting (feels like a slab of thick cardboard, and is semi-slippery). I enjoy some flexibility, which this does not provide.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic paper!
customer_reviews.text: I love this notebook! First, The paper is Amazing!! I tested this with watercolors and several pens and markers. The paper really held up and I found very little to no bleeding/ghosting! I have added a photo of a page I cover with watercolor, stamped letters, and darkened with Staedtlers and there was nothing showing through on the backside! Second, I have a love hate relationship with the cover itself. It’s very smooth and nice to the touch. However, it’s very easy to scratch and it arrived with permanent elastic marks dug into the cover. Also attached a picture of this. Personally love the paper in this and will continue to buy this notebook for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well with fountain pens
customer_reviews.text: Nice little notepad for jotting down your thoughts. I initially thought the dot style paper would be distracting but it works really well to help alline my words and once an page is filled the dots fade into the background. Bookmark is an nice touch, I wish there was an 2nd one. The elastic closure works well to secure the pages when you are not using it. If you twist your pen into the elastic it will hold it in place till you are ready to write again. There is even a little pocket in the back of the notebook that perfectly fits a few business cards.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Paz

customer_reviews.title: Safe Keeping for Your Messed Up Mind
customer_reviews.text: This little black book is gorgeous. Writing in it will make you feel like you're Lady Murasaki penning the world's first ever novel. Its leatherette visage is solid, subtly glossy and especially luxurious in black. While too small for my diatribes against McDonald's and their decision to discontinue McWraps, I use this mini Rhodia to record the most pressing issues on my agenda, like my 8 AM meeting or remembering that Jessica Simpson and Diana Ross are in-laws.
customer_reviews.author: RANDYRANDALL

customer_reviews.title: Overall decent notebook; mine came with a banged up cover.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Heavy weight paper is has somewhat less ink bleed than a Leuchtturm 1917. The paper has a scratchy feel, and it readily absorbs ink. Cons: Not enough in the way of quality to justify this over a Leuchtturm 1917. It has about 100 less sheets of paper, the print of the dots are too dark for my taste (making it harder to distinguish from your pens ink), there’s no given indexing or page numbers, and only one bookmark. Mine came with a banged up cover. Overall a decent notebook, but my tastes lie elsewhere. Personally I reccomend the Leuchtturm 1917, especially for bullet journaling
customer_reviews.author: Greyson

customer_reviews.title: A solid premium basic notebook
customer_reviews.text: It's a quality notebook, not much in ways of extras but the quality is solid. It has one bookmark ribbon, and the elastic band to keep it closed. One pocket in the back but no labels or other freebies. The paper is fairly yellow/dark cream, the dots are dark enough that they don't fade into the background under writing. It feels very nice to write on though, super smooth and luxurious. It's a hard cover with a nice leatherette feel.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wu

customer_reviews.title: Best dot grid notebook for fountain pens.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried probably 10 different brands of dot notebook for bullet journalling and I always come back to Rhodia because of the paper quality. If you write with a fountain pen, it goes like this: Moleskine (crappy) -> Leuchtturm (good enough but still ghosting) -> Scribbles That Matter (really quite good indeed) -> Rhodia (the ultimate).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it! My first fountain pen friendly notebook
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! My first fountain pen friendly notebook. Since using it I have moved on to Tomoe River paper notebooks. Likes -I loved the pocket in the back -slightly cream color paper Dislikes -the price for the # of pages
customer_reviews.author: mistertimothy.ga

customer_reviews.title: The best notebook I have ever had the pleasure of making my acquaintance
customer_reviews.text: Can't rave enough about this notebook. The paper feels like a beautiful French woman whispering in your ear about which desserts she is going to make you every night for the rest of your life. The cover is pleasantly springy, yet durable. Dot matrix print is the pinnacle of mankind's paper ruling achievement. Wrote on this with everything from bold fountain pens to sharpies and nothing bled through. Made the perfect bullet journal other than the fact that I ran out of pages by September. 10/10 would buy this notebook and rub it on my cheek for hours again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Broekhuijsen

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it already!
customer_reviews.text: I am a notebook addict and I wanted to find a notebook that I can use for notes and journaling. Pros: - Paper is smooth - Paper is thick (enough) - dot grid is straight - inside cover is black (unlike other notebooks) - has band to keep it shut - has ribbon to mark your place Cons: - None
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: THIS PAPER FEATHERS VERY VERY BADLY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I dont get what type of special magical fountain pens and magic ink they are using?!?!?! BECAUSE THIS PAPER FEATHERS VERY VERY VERY BADLY!!!!! i own over 100 fountain pens and more than 200 bottles of ink, i have always bought TOMOE RIVER journals. I took a chance on this and went to write in it an hour ago... feathered so bad it made me cringe. So i changed pen and ink...same... again... same. I am a full time professional artist and i have about 20 different pens all with different ink, inked up on hand... every single one feathers so badly i threw it in the trash... iam not happy
customer_reviews.author: Dj doyle

customer_reviews.title: If you use a Fountain Pen, you need this.
customer_reviews.text: Given that I am a stationary nerd who loves his fountain pens, one of these is always with me. They are simply the best. If you use a FP you can’t just use regular paper, you need to get the right stuff to show off your ink and not get terrible bleed through. I have never had a problem with these and I use it everyday for work . I have spent hundreds of dollars on journals from other brands and have never found one that works like these, with the exception of the hard to find Clairfontaine ones you can get from france (though I think rue are part of ge same company).
customer_reviews.author: M.J. Hullett

customer_reviews.title: It’s nice. But..
customer_reviews.text: I love this book and it’s actually my second Rhodia, but this one isn’t straight with the dots. The go at an angle and they don’t line up from page to page. My last one was literally perfect which is why I got this one so to say I’m disappointed is an understatement. The paper quality is good, no ghosting on any of my pens HOWEVER they are coated or something because they do smear.
customer_reviews.author: Tezra Rigo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Notebook for Bullet Journal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this notebook to use as my first bullet journal. I was concerned about pens and markers ghosting through on the back side of the pages, but there is hardly anything visible. I've been using the Sakura Micron pens and the feel on the paper is incredibly smooth. I've never written on anything like this paper before. Great feel, high quality binding, perfect for a bullet journal. I checked all my pages and I didn't run into the issue with the mis-aligned dots like some of the other reviews have. I guess it's hit or miss. I would highly recommend this journal.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn R. Sambol

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Daily Planning & Journaling
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about making a mess of my journal, but it is so easy to draw straight lines even without a ruler. The pages are set up perfectly for use as a planner. It's easy to create and duplicate charts if you want to track your weight or mood. Also very easy to create checklists. There is minimal ghosting (I've been using a Faber Castell artist pens and crayola markers today) but it isn't too distracting. The paper is smooth and the cover is very sturdy. This is a must if a typical planner doesn't cut it for you. Bullet journals are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price! Perfect for Bullet Journaling
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this journal. I bought it for a bullet journal and it is great. The paper is smooth and the paper weight is heavy, so zero to little "ghosting" (no bleeding so far). Some pens take a bit to dry and could smear, but I use Papermate InkJoy Gel pens (my fave!) and they dry instantly. It has an elastic band that holds it closed, a ribbon bookmark built in, as well as a pocket in the back cover. It's hardback and feels as though it could last a long time and endure lots of wear. The dot grid is nice and straight and consistent throughout. Excellent quality, great price! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LadyGypsy84

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bullet journals!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my bullet journal. I love the color and its brightness - it brings a smile to my face when I pull it out to write in it...which is half the battle to keeping up with the journaling...you have to be drawn to your supplies or you'll never want to use them! I use a fountain pen (the Pilot Metropolitan), Tombow dual tip markers, and Staedtler fine liners in this journal and haven't had any bleeding...even when coloring in items. I do wish it came with multiple page markers in different colors, but that's nothing that some post-it tabs can't remedy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for bullet journal!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great notebook that's perfect to use as a bullet journal. The pages are a thick, smooth ivory and the construction is very sturdy. I love whatever fake leather the cover's made with because it feel soft to the touch. The bookmark ribbon is just at the length of annoyance though (a mm longer would be perfect) but that's barely worth mentioning. Overall, I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Great multipurpose notebook, especially for lefties!
customer_reviews.text: Because I am left-handed, I tend to write with a extra fine point permanent marker or a fountain pen (because of their design, ball-point pens constantly fail for lefties) so this notebook is great because the heavy-weight paper eliminates the ink bleed from these types of pens. Also spiral-bound notebooks are literally a pain to use as a lefty as the spiral binding digs into your arm as you write, so the standard book binding on these notebooks are great! Without even considering that, these notebooks are great to carry around and jot things down. I use one at work, home, for to-do lists, meeting notes, etc. I would recommend these to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Gray McElveen

customer_reviews.title: Not fountain pen friendly
customer_reviews.text: Not too fond of the cover or paper quality. Not fountain pen friendly, as opposed to common belief. If your fp or ink is a wet writer, it WILL bleed and feather. Waste of money if you're going to use as fountain pen notebook. Cover is fragile as the band that keeps book closed has left a permanent "dent" all the way down the cover. Ridiculous if you ask me. Buy a notebook using tomoe river paper instead. This notebook is Not fountain pen friendly.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Life is too short for junk!
customer_reviews.text: This black Rhodia notebook is a wonder! The sturdy cover feels luxurious beyond the price. The multiple interior features gradually become indispensable. The paper is just wonderful. Writing in this notebook is a sheer pleasure, even if the writing itself is not worth rereading... I am never without mine. Once you own and use one of these notebooks, you will understand all the rave reviews, you will think the price is incidental, you will congratulate yourself on your improving good sense, and you will never again settle for pulp.
customer_reviews.author: j mark schmearer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed: defective
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this was an off market reject. I didnt realize it until I started using it but the pages are misaligned and folded along the binding. The Rhodia imprint on the cover is even incorrect. I will be calling the retailer to order directly next time. The cover material and pages are of the standard quality.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: measurements are off
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as an A6 size (105 x 148 mm / 4.1 x 5.8 in) but it's smaller. Even the small, partial slip cover doesn't even say "A6"; it says 9 x 14 cm ( = 90 x 140 mm) on the French side and 3.5 x 5.5 in on the English side. (Even including the protruding cover, the width is less than 95 mm.) Sloppy product description for a supposedly upscale product. Caveat emptor. Funny, the French side says "192 pages" and the English "96 sheets." There appear to be a dozen sections of 8 sheets each, so at least that math is legit.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone

customer_reviews.title: the measurements are all wrong, i think this product ...
customer_reviews.text: the measurements are all wrong, i think this product is fake ive purchased many rhodia notebooks before. im totally dis-satisfied save your money, DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Al-Qatami

customer_reviews.title: Good book overall
customer_reviews.text: I bought this notebook to use as a bullet journal. Great overall! I love the thickness of the pages, but ink can go through a little bit. The dots aren't completely even in the pages. I like that it has a bookmark ribbon and the leather-like cover is really nice. If you throw things around like I do, it can be easily scratched/damaged though. Great journal overall, would recommend for bullet journal enthusiasts. I used G2 pens for the photo, but Staedtler pens would be much better for bullet journaling in this notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Definite Quality, but choose a darker color
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for bullet journalling and use it every day. After 5 months of heavy use, the elastic is still going strong. The cover is kind fo a soft material and is definitely showing signs of wear- I doubt it will ever look clean again, and the corners are a little pitted. The paper has a wonderful feel to it, heavy and smooth, like a beautiful old book. Would definitely purchase again, but in a darker color that won't show the wear so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality, great to write in...
customer_reviews.text: A note book like this is a must if you write with a fountain pen. I have been using these for a few years after the Moleskine's started to drop in quality. This Rhodia notebook has nice sturdy smooth pages which makes writing a joy. I prefer the dot grid as it lets me configure the page for how I want to take notes (of course a blank page can do the same but the dots make it easy to split the page up). I am pretty rough on these books and over time the corners get banged up but the binding seems to hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: Almost everything I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: The notebook is almost everything I was looking for. I say almost because there are a few caveats. First, I'm using this as a sketchbook for work doing UI design. I like to draw with a micron pen and the ink from that pen will bleed onto the next page, which is unfortunate. Using grayscale pens won't bleed too much but black micron will bleed. Second, I'd say starting about halfway through the book and alternating about every 10 pages, there are about 20-30 pages that do not have any dot grid on them and are completely blank. Which, isn't a huge deal but it's a lot more than I would have expected for such a highly rated product.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: I Found My Favorite Art Journal Paper!
customer_reviews.text: I was in love with Tomoe River paper until I tried this Rhodia Webnotebook. This is a great book for art journaling. I love watercoloring on the thin "crispy" paper for my everyday journaling. Like Tomoe River paper, this paper can take fountain pens, watercolor, acrylics, colored pencil and some markers. Alcohol markers do bleed through. Unlike the Tomoe River paper, this paper can handle my Winsor and Newton watercolor markers. But best of all, this is the only journal paper I've used that doesn't bleed through when I watercolor on top of ink. When I fill this journal, I will be purchasing another. I found my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Pocketbat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bullet journaling, taking notes!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this notebook for bullet journaling. It is perfect because it has dotted grid pages and the paper is thick enough to handle all my pens and markers, including permanent markers. It also has a handy fold/pocket at the end of the notebook where I have space to keep a thin ruler. Highly recommend for bullet journaling, or taking notes in general. Will be purchasing again after I finish using it up!
customer_reviews.author: J C

customer_reviews.title: Rhodia = Best Paper & Dot Grid = Best Layout.
customer_reviews.text: Rhodia uses Clairefontaine paper made in France. It's very smooth, silky paper with enough weight (90g/m2) so that most decent pens will not bleed through. The dot grid is perfect for drawing sketches or writing and is never obtrusive like graph paper or ruled lines. It is like blank paper, narrow ruled, and graph paper all in one. These have a ribbon marker and elastic band. They also have an expanding back pocket for small cards, notes, cash, and other objects. There is an extra black page at the front and back & the inside covers are black so you can write there with metallic gel pens or white. Pricy but the quality is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mercury

customer_reviews.title: Very good for sketching on the go. (personally, I like it better than Moleskine AND it's artsy)
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality (AND it comes in multiple sizes). I love the paper quality. I'd say that it's best for pencil sketches, but I'm sure there are a multitude of uses. If you're a dedicated artist, looking for a dedicated sketchbook, then this is a perfect gift to yourself, or an artsy loved one. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Superior Paper quality and Durable Construction
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through no fewer than 7 of these journals in the past 2 years, and have gifted at least 3 to friends and family in that same time frame. Before this, I decided to try almost every acclaimed journal –– including Leuchturm, Moleskine, Best Self, Baron Fig, Field Notes, Public Supply –– and Rhodia emerges as the clear winner. The paper is unparalleled in quality. At 90 GSM, it is heavy enough to prevent bleed, but this isn't the only (nor the most important) metric for paper quality. The paper is smooth, a quality which is hard to measure but unmistakable in the user's experience. I cannot recommend Rhodia notebooks enough!
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: Great paper, solid construction, upscale fit & finish.
customer_reviews.text: This little notebook was a revelation. I usually go for the much simpler Field Notes or the slightly more upscale Moleskine notebooks, so this Rhodia was just a test run. As a result, I think I might stick with Rhodia for a while now. This notebook does seem a bit pricey, but once you have experienced the quality of its paper you will understand.
customer_reviews.author: AZOT

customer_reviews.title: I love the paper in these.
customer_reviews.text: As with my larger Rhodia Webnotebook, and my two sizes of Rhoda DotPads, I love the Clairefontaine dot grid vellum in this notebook. This particular book I bought specifically for practicing hiragana with fountain pens, and I have yet to find a paper that I like more for fountain pen writing than this. If I have need for another hardcover notebook this size, I will almost certainly buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Perrin

customer_reviews.title: Best small notebook with great real hardcover
customer_reviews.text: I love this small hardcover notebook. I write with fountain pens. Not even fancy ones. I think on my night table with my book is. 15 buck pen. Anyway, this book is filled with beautiful Clairfontaine paper, buttery to the touch and just a pleasure to write on. I use it to keep on my night stand so I can slightly journal. I haven’t needed a second yet as I don’t use it each and every day, but will probably buy two next time.
customer_reviews.author: jkm

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The soft/hard cover is flimsy. Hard to write in the journal while its laying flat. The threadwork was horrible
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Solid notebook for bullet journaling
customer_reviews.text: So I finally jumped on this whole bullet journal craze. There were a lot of conflicting reviews on which journal was the best to get, but I finally settled on this one. So far I am very happy with it. You can see the ink from the other side of the page, but that doesn't bother me. I was only worried about ink actually bleeding through. The paper has a nice quality feel of it, and I like the dots more than I think I would like the grid format. Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Caramel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book and paper
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a journal and I like the color of the paper and the quality of the paper at 90G you don't see any bleed through at all. This is excellent paper and this is what I will be using going forward. The Fountain Pen writes extremely smooth on this paper.
customer_reviews.author: Brent N. Butler

customer_reviews.title: The best paper around!
customer_reviews.text: You honestly can't beat Rhodia paper. I've tested a variety of pens on my Rhodia, and even filling in areas with a felt pen (such as papermate flair) doesn't result in any bleed-through. There's also much less shadowing than any other brand I've tried. It even stands up to watercolor details. I might just be a Rhodia customer for life. The dot grid is also perfect for bullet journaling and fauxbonichi. My only wish is that they would create this journal in more colors. The bright orange is not my bag, but if they sold these in mint or teal I'd be over the moon.
customer_reviews.author: Katharina M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but didn’t meet expectation.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly had high expectations when I bought this book. I experienced some ghosting and bleed through on normal everyday pens that normally don’t bleed through stuff. I started using this as a bullet journal and the washi tape I use ghosts through as well. I am happy because it is a well made book and it looks like it will hold up well. The cover feels really nice, but the band to keep the book closed leaves dents/imprints on the cover. Over all, I really like this journal, but I think it is too overpriced for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Gangof5

customer_reviews.title: I like it but...
customer_reviews.text: There is definitely some bleed through to the back of the page, which is a little disappointing. If I write with my regular black pen (Signio Micro 207) there's no ghosting. But if I use any of my art pens the bleed through is pretty bad. Which is kind of a bummer because I was really looking forward to fancying up my Bullet Journal more with color. Maybe I'll try using colored pencils instead. I'm still going to use it. It's a great size. I love the heft of the cover and the dotted paper but I don't know if I'll get this one again. May try Lechtturm next time or maybe Nuuna.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy L. Farley

customer_reviews.title: Great for fountain pens
customer_reviews.text: This notebook is a pleasure to write in with my fountain pen. The paper is very good quality. I can write on both front and back of the pages without seeing any bleed through. Nice, slightly padded, hard cover. The notebook lays flat when it is opened. I also like the line spacing, which is 7 mm. I have previously used a Moleskine Cahier and I like this one much better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Zuber

customer_reviews.title: The grid layout is excellent for lettering practice
customer_reviews.text: Rhodia paper is exactly what everyone says it is. Smooth, high quality, an absolute dream to write on. The grid layout is excellent for lettering practice, and I'll occasionally rip out something I particularly like to recreate it on blank paper using a light pad. The price is high and I probably should have been more selective for it's use (technically you can practice on plain ole legal pads for a fraction of the price, but honestly you can feeeel the difference in the paper quality)
customer_reviews.author: Ciarra LusterTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Paper, but too Thin for Inks
customer_reviews.text: The paper is buttery smooth, but way to thin for ink pens. Sure the ink doesn't "bleed" through the paper, but you can see the in through the paper when you try to write on the back side of the page. Also, you can see the ink through the paper from a page before (say you write on page 4 if you are on page 2 you can see the ink through the page even though it isn't on the same physical sheet of paper). Nice paper, but way to thin, but I am using whatever Lamy cartridge blue ink that came with the pen and it is very visible though the paper.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Yancey

customer_reviews.title: One really nice notebook.  Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is some really nice paper. My Pelikan M600 bled through moleskine notebooks like none other. Mont Blanc ink, Pilot Iroshizuki, Pelikan ink. They all bled through. I had been writing with Claire Fontaine Triomphe stationary for a bit, and when I saw a review for this notebook, with Claire Fontaine paper, I figured I would give it a try. Never going back to moleskine for journaling. They are great notebooks, but this one is better.
customer_reviews.author: Dell

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE LISTED SIZE
customer_reviews.text: It claims to be a "Silver Webnotebook 5.5X8.25 Lined" but is in fact 3.5x5.5 inches in size. Do not buy this unless you think a tiny notebook is worth this price. I don't know what the quality is, as I will be sending it back for a replacement of the proper size or a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth King

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Bullet Journaling!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend the high price on the leuchttrum when I'm just beginning Bullet Journaling so I found this one. I knew I wanted the dot format and wanted thick enough pages. This journal is amazing for the price!! There is no bleed through unless you used markers. But with pens or sharpie pens there's no bleeding. Just a little shadowing if you go over the same line numerous times with a dark color. There is even a pocket in the back that I keep my stickers in which is perfect! The pages aren't numbered but that's no big doaeal o me, I enjoy numbering them myself. I love this journal and will order another one!
customer_reviews.author: EricaLeann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Notebook and Excellent paper
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Notebook and Excellent paper. I'm moving to another planner system but I'll bring the rhodia paper with me. Despite being a "leatherette" and smelling a bit funny to start, the spine softens up beautifully over timeand is still incredibly durable. The cover scars but you get used to it. As it got even more scarred I picked up some nice vinyl stickers and put those over it and it looked awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Mika Andrew

customer_reviews.title: and I'm extremely happy I chose this one
customer_reviews.text: I researched several brands of these books before deciding on this one, and I'm extremely happy I chose this one. The paper is luxurious and phenomenal. It's incredibly smooth and resists ghosting/bleed through, yet the pages still have a thin feel to them. I have stacks of notebooks I've used over the years, and this is most definitely the best paper I've ever written on. It doesn't feather and has seemingly zero friction, allowing for perfectly smooth, skip-free writing. I have since purchased each available color (black, orange, silver).
customer_reviews.author: Tdawg

customer_reviews.title: Great notebook!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful notebook: the dots were a new thing to me, but it makes writing more fun and interesting. I bought one for my boyfriend and he throws it in his bag and lugs it around with him everywhere, and this thing has held up great so far! Always helpful if you're an on-the-go kind of person. It inevitably rains, and this can handle a few drops on the cover without it soaking the pages, it can handle getting moved around in a backpack during bike rides and bus rides. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: KamWow

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and durable
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the paper is excellent in my opinion! I have use this notebook for the past six months to keep daily records and I found it to be the perfect size and made with quality hard cover!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I love it so much
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first bullet journal (bujo) after doing some research, and I am in love with it. The only problem i have with this is that the elastic closure left a really deep (permanent) mark on the cover of the notebook, but i decided to overlook that because i just instinctively put the closure over that spot when i'm done using my bujo. I sometimes get pencil smudge marks because i carry it in my backpack sometimes, but they're not that hard to rub off with my thumb. I am satisfied with my purchase and would maybe buy another one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jia

customer_reviews.title: Great paper, ok notebook
customer_reviews.text: The paper in the Rhodia notebooks is great. It works with pens, pencils, markers, etc. without bleed. It's nice and thick, a great color, and is a very pleasant writing surface. However, the binding is not great, and roughly 2 cm on either side of the seam in the pages is difficult to use due to the way the pages bulge. If the binding were better, this would be a great product, but the binding really holds its usability back.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: which is something I want out of a good sketchbook. The dots make it simple to lay ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a sucker for sketchbooks of this size and own several. I use this one at work in a design studio and it serves me well. I routinely use an ultra-fine Sharpie marker and there's very little visibility on the other side of the page, which is something I want out of a good sketchbook. The dots make it simple to lay out grids for drawing logos and typography or as guides for freehand drawing. Excellent paper quality and binding. I'm not a huge fan of the soft material on the cover, but it's not a deal breaker. I'd buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Paper for Fountain Pen Ink!
customer_reviews.text: Rhodia “Webbies” contain, IMHO, the best paper for not only fountain pen ink, but pretty much every ink I’ve used. I find the sizes available are quite convenient for my various uses, and like that they are available with various preprinted page guides (such as dots, lines, blank, etc.). The are structured very similarly to the venerable Moleskine books, but are bound with superior paper made by Crane.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Barest

customer_reviews.title: great notebook
customer_reviews.text: Great little notebook, about 99% fountain pen friendly (a very few leaks through, like periods i was slow to lift the pen). I think this is a great replacement for the notebooks I have had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: akforeverlost

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: the paper in this is as you'd expect from Rhodia, and if you are a little ocd the dots make it that much better. overall construction makes this feel really quality and well built, papers are sewn together not glued. use: when writing with a fountain pen ink did not bleed through the page, however as expected, with an oil based sharpie it bled but only slightly on to the other side, not through the stack note: the orange color does get slightly dirty, but it's such a cool vibrant color it's worth it
customer_reviews.author: Maybach

customer_reviews.title: Rhodia Webnotebook Dot
customer_reviews.text: Great paper, takes any ink. Smooth and strong. Nice cover. Only con is the elastic strap that will fail eventually. But I write in it daily as a journal and it's held up so far. Some complain about the length of the page mark, I think it's long enough. Not a big deal. Paper is a creamy color, makes some inks not as vivid, just beware. Overall, very nice notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M

customer_reviews.title: Erasing pencil marks is also fairly easy, and leaves no marks behind
customer_reviews.text: The pages are crisp, the dots are not too dark that they overpower my writing, and the sheets are fountain pen friendly. I've used medium nibbed fountain pens, staedtler triplus fineliners, and marvy lepens to write in it, with no issues. Erasing pencil marks is also fairly easy, and leaves no marks behind. The small folder in the back for storage is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nob

customer_reviews.title: Moleskin's Better Cousin
customer_reviews.text: Let me start this off by saying that I was looking for a journal that was comparable to the quality of Moleskin but had thicker pages. The Rhodia Webnotebook delivered that and more! The pages are identical to Moleskin's but the ghosting doesn't really occur through the pages. This was what always drove me nuts about Moleskin, especially using thicker/colored pens. With this notebook I can draw or do anything in the pages and there is barely any ghosting to the next page. Definitely my go-to journal from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella

customer_reviews.title: The best bullet journal I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: And I'm not exaggerating! Very little chance of things bleeding though (my Pentel brush pen does if I overdo the inking), the book OPENS FLAT which is an absolute heaven-send for doing two-page layouts, and the best part? I didn't realize there was a pocket in the back! All of this for less than I've paid for some moleskin notebooks! Definitely going to be my go-to in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Baker

customer_reviews.title: Best notebook for bullet journaling!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this notebook for the second time! I am very into bullet journaling and much prefer this over the other ones I've tried including the leuchtturm 1917 notebook! Pens don't bleed through the paper and it is the perfect size for me! Would recommend this to anyone interested in bullet journaling!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Mac

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a top quality notebook. Perfect for my bullet journal! The paper is soft and thick. The price is decent as well and its fast shipping. I love this notebook! Although I get a hold of nuuna notebooks.
customer_reviews.author: Marie G

customer_reviews.title: Love Rhodia dot grid notebooks!
customer_reviews.text: I got this little notebook for doodle pics. It’s fun to draw designs using the dot grids. I love how smooth the paper is. It’s a pleasure to draw and color on with gel pens. I use the larger size Rhodia dot grid webnotebooks for my bullet journal, so I knew I’d enjoy doodling in this one.
customer_reviews.author: DangerPoodle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fountain pens
customer_reviews.text: Great for fountain pens. The paper is silky smooth and doesn't bleed and next to no ghosting. I am a moleskine notebook user and I switched because the moleskine paper absorbs to much ink.
customer_reviews.author: deedubz

customer_reviews.title: paper is nice and thick and does not bleed but i wish ...
customer_reviews.text: paper is nice and thick and does not bleed but i wish there was something to keep the notebook open or it had a soft cover.
customer_reviews.author: James Lee

customer_reviews.title: Impressed! Not bad for an entry notebook
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels really premium if that makes any sense haha! Coming from someone who doesn't bullet journal or anything serious, this is just a nice piece to have as a work notebook and it's always a joy to pick up after having used the standard spiral backed notebooks and pocket books from B&N.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: It's good, but I don't know that it's worth it over the cheaper options. The paper is fairly thick but bleed through is still an issue with thicker pens.
customer_reviews.author: QWilson

customer_reviews.title: The cover and pages are very nice on this
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 4 stars only because there is a very little bit of bleed through between pages. That said, it is far less than Moleskins. The cover and pages are very nice on this, and the size is perfect for bullet journaling. I use Tombow and Pentel Sign markers, Microns and Pentel gel pens. I notice the most bleeding with the Tombows. I will purchase this again once I fill it up.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gray

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice, it's very sturdy (I ought to know
customer_reviews.text: I searched long & hard to find precisely what I wanted for my first bullet journal & this specific notebook, in theory, is what met all my standards. Thankfully, it has in practice, too. It looks nice, it's very sturdy (I ought to know, I take it everywhere & do not exercise caution with it), the pages are thick enough that no ink bleeds through, I regularly receive compliments on it, & it has that terrific dot-grid I was searching for.
customer_reviews.author: TheBowlerCapFairy

customer_reviews.title: Ripped off
customer_reviews.text: Flawless paper, but very shoddy construction. Corners of pages not rounded symmetrically, ripples in the cover, and it arrived bent as though it had been improperly stored for some time. Really very shoddy workmanship. Better off just buying the Clairefontaine binder paper. Rhodia paper isn't available in loose sheets, while the Clairefontaine paper is. That strikes me as odd. In any event the Rhodia Webnotebook is vastly overpriced and very poorly built.
customer_reviews.author: P. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great notebooks!
customer_reviews.text: I love these notebooks. I just wish they weren't so darn expensive. I use a fountain pen, which I love, and the ink rarely goes through (sometimes when I go back over something, or cross something out). I prefer the dotted grid--it gives me guides without having a whole bunch of lines all over the space, and does not limit when I doodle or draw little pictures now and then.
customer_reviews.author: eleder

customer_reviews.title: Great journal. Better paper than Moleskine
customer_reviews.text: Bought this notebook to use as a journal. It's great. I have owned a Rhodia Journal before and I really appreciate the paper quality. I have primarily written in my Rhodia Journals with a felt-tipped sharpie pen and normal pressure and writing speeds do not result in bleed through. I have used Moleskine before and these pens usually bleed through the grid and dot paper (the two paper types I use most).
customer_reviews.author: Flop

customer_reviews.title: Love this notebook
customer_reviews.text: Love this notebook! I use Tombow markers and there is hardly any bleedthroughs, except where I rubbed the marker in way too much. You can slightly see through the pages if I add a lot of color, but it does not show through like other thinner papers. Perfect size for a medium sized purse. Will repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: GMaria

customer_reviews.title: Great Notebook!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful pages to write on! Perfect for any writing tool. I love fountain pens, and these pages provide a great writing experience for fountain pens!
customer_reviews.author: Iris Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Coated Paper
customer_reviews.text: I love this little dotted notebook. I do calligraphy so the dot grid is great, the paper is super smooth and coated which makes it great for my fountain pen. The only thing is that the cover leather is a bit too delicate and easily dirties.
customer_reviews.author: Megan H.Top Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: The perfect journal
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this notebook. The paper is nice, and there is minimal ghosting with my Micron pen. The notebook stays open on my desk, and I love that the pages don't try to turn - it stays open on whatever page I want. Great size, quality feel.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: I use it for bullet journaling
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this notebook. I have been loyal to the rhodia brand since I first started using the bullet journal system. Its the only thing I'll use. The paper is smooth, great quality! I use micro-line, pilot v5, and tombow dual brush pens. Very highly recommend this product The color is not too bright. I was a little worried about that because I've always used the black ones. 5/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Katarina Forgy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic notebook. The pages are slightly thinner that I anticipated but so far I haven't had much of a problem with bleed-through. It should be noted that the paper is NOT the same as the original Rhodia dot pads. Nevertheless its a great notebook. High quality. The only thing I wish it had is numbered pages. Not a big deal for me but if I had one improvement to suggest, it would be that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than moleskine
customer_reviews.text: I would really give this 4.5 stars because the cover is noticably cheaper but the paper is superior to moleskine. It's smoother, thicker, and the ink dries quicker. Moleskine suffers from bad ghosting and bleed through while this showed ZERO of either with a bold 1.0 uniball jet stream. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Yepp

customer_reviews.title: Rhodia > Moleskine
customer_reviews.text: Quality of this journal is amazing. Since moleskine sucks now with paper quality (pens are bleeding through) I was on the search for a good journal. This one is it. Same dimensions, quality paper, opens flat, has a pocket and elastic around it. This journal is now my go to.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great Journal
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second Rhodia journal and I love these. The cover is solid, lays flat, fountain pen friendly, and has a pocket on the back for pieces of paper, postage, etc. The size is perfect and can't think of a way to improve this product.
customer_reviews.author: R Brown

customer_reviews.title: French design, made in Morocco.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a quality notebook that wasn’t made in China. This fit the bill. Made in Morocco and impressed with quality.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent F Simmon Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great for fountain pen users
customer_reviews.text: This works well with fountain pens. I use it for work. I like how it folds flat, and that there's a ribbon bookmark. For fountain pen users, this is a much better choice than a moleskine book because the paper is thick enough to not let ink bleed through. I wish I could fold it all the way around so it would take up less desk space, but it is unreasonable for me to expect that from this type of book.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen Chen

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my pens
customer_reviews.text: I am really liking this so far. The paper is very smooth to write on and my pens don't bleed through so I can use both sides of the page for my journal. I use Staedtler Fineliner pens to write and accent with color and I also use Koi Coloring Brush Pens for larger swatches of color. Since I use a lot of color, I would love it if they made a white page notebook as well but until then I am very happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: These Webbys make writing glide like butter on a hot pan
customer_reviews.text: There are only two notebooks in my life now; my Fieldnotes, and my Webby. These Webbys make writing glide like butter on a hot pan, and the subtle dots make it easy to draw straight lines, or ignore them entirely. Having dabbled in dip pens, these work wonders, though I don't use dip pens on a normal basis. But this is my 3rd or 4th Webby, and I think I'm sold for life.
customer_reviews.author: Leia C

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Notebook, Feels great, looks great
customer_reviews.text: I love notebooks. I like to take notes and keep an "ideas" diary. I've tries many, many different notebooks over the years but this one is fantastic. The paper feels great. I love the "dot pattern" b/c many of my notes require drawing or sketching things and the dot pattern facilitates that w/o getting too much in the way as a grid paper does. Its small enough for easy carrying into meetings or setting on a desk w/o taking up much space. Very aesthetically pleasing, feels great and overall a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: N. T. Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Nice, high quality notebook
customer_reviews.text: Thick paper with little to no bleeding, nice stiff cover with soft leather wrap. Very nice notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Chance Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great, fountain pen ink doesn't leak trough
customer_reviews.text: This is the first notebook I.ve used that fountain pen ink hasn't leaked through. I'll purchase this notebook again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bleeding and ghosting.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a really beautiful notebook, but I bought it for a specific purpose. I did research on different notebooks looking for paper sturdiness. Many of the reviews pointed to this notebook because its sturdy paper prevented most ink and marker mediums from bleeding through. Unfortunately, even my lightest micron pens are ghosting onto the other side of the page. If you need a notebook that doesn’t easily ghost, this may not be the one for you. The paper itself is very smooth and really nice to write on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No inky bleed through!
customer_reviews.text: This journal is the perfect size to slide into my bag; the dots keep my entries tidy; the bookmark and built-in rubberband make keeping track of things easy; and best of all, my fountain pen ink doesn't leak into the other side of the page. I'll be purchasing this again.
customer_reviews.author: Shazzie J

customer_reviews.title: Amazon messed up my order...again.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Rohdia A5 blank notebook. As you can see in the pictures that's not what I received. I'm too tired to return it, and I always find a use for these notebooks. For some reason I do not understand amazon messes up my notebook orders. Oh if I could just find a local store. I like Rohdia notebooks--they are great. Getting what you ordered is tough.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Loved it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister in law and she loves it. she hasn't had any trouble with bleed through on the pages and the journal lays nice and flat. I will say the pages feel slick and would probably make it harder to control your pen. (She doesn't seem to have any trouble, but she has naturally pretty hand writing.)
customer_reviews.author: Beth Monk

product_meta.title: Rhodia A5 Webnotebook, Dot, Black
product_meta.description:
Size:A5| Style:Dot| Color:BlackRhodia A5 Webnotebook, Dot, Black

SET CONTAINS:
1 x Rhodia Webnotebook
feature_bullets: Size of web notebook - A5/140 x 210 mm
The paper within the web notebook is 90 g Ivory Brushed Vellum
The web notebook has a leatherette cover with an elasticated strap
The web notebook has a coloured ribbon and an expanding pocket at the back for loose documents

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,099 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
